result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald Lynn Grisle Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Pay all court costs, fees and surcharges.  To be paid from up to 25% of prison funds.  To be paid from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance paid during Extended supervision.  Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.

****DECISION & ORDER dated 9-24-2014/Judge J.D.Watts/ defendant's request for sentence credit is DENIED.  FURTHER ORDERED that the JOC shall be amended to include a total of 89 days of sentence credit.****
Concurrent with: Concurrent to 11CF175.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. J.D. Watts, Br. 15, calendar successor, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for sentence credit.

Defendant Ronald Lynn Grisle in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Ronald Lynn Grisle in custody.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
 Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Sentencing proceeded.  Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 66 MONTHS, concurrent to 11CF175, credit for 99 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 42 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS. 
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program; is eligible or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-No new violations that rise to the level of probable cause.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.  No use or possession of illegal drugs.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges, to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
-Provide DNA Sample.

Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief. 
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Ronald Lynn Grisle in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Ronald Lynn Grisle in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense withdraws the motion.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
State's Response to the Defendant's Motion to Suppress received and filed./ds
State's Motion in Limine and Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Evidence received and filed./ds

Attorney Daryl A. Kastenson in court, defendant Ronald Lynn Grisle not in court, in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Motions to be filed by 3-17-14; response/reply by 4-1-14.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ronald Lynn Grisle in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Ronald Lynn Grisle in custody.  William Levins for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #11CF175 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Curtis Pelczynski-MPD Officer.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION to be monitored by drug testing.    Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia.    Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Ronald Lynn Grisle in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Ronald Lynn Grisle in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
